head.title: $775 Million Bond Offering From Dormitory Authority

identified-content.classifier: Top/Classifieds/Job Market/Job Categories/Banking, Finance and Insurance

hedline.hl1: $775 Million Bond Offering From Dormitory Authority

block.p: LEAD: The Dormitory Authority of the State of New York offered $775 million of bonds for the City University of New York yesterday.
LEAD: The Dormitory Authority of the State of New York offered $775 million of bonds for the City University of New York yesterday.
The Dormitory Authority of the State of New York offered $775 million of bonds for the City University of New York yesterday.
The negotiated offering consisted of serial, term and zero-coupon securities. Various issues were insured.

The serial bonds range in maturity from 1992 to 2001. Uninsured bonds were offered with coupons from 6.50 percent in 1992 and 7.35 percent in 1997. Serial bonds maturing in 2001 were offered with a coupon of 7.05 percent.

The largest part of the issue is $155 million of term bonds that mature in 2010. These carry a 7.50 percent coupon and were priced to yield 7.575 percent. An insured term bond maturing in 2014 has a 7 percent coupon and was priced to yield 7.40 percent.
The uninsured portions of the offering are rated A by Moody's Investors Service Inc. and BBB+ by the Standard & Poor's Corporation.

Morgan Stanley & Company acted as lead manager for the underwriting. Investment bankers familiar with the deal said yesterday that demand for the securities was strong, and that the entire issue was spoken for.
